abstract.text: An operation that confirms a user’s participation in a share.

inlineContent.text: Use this operation to accept participation in one or more shares. You create the operation with an array of share metadatas, which CloudKit provides to your app when the user taps or clicks a share’s
. The method CloudKit calls varies by platform and app configuration. For more information, see
. You can also fetch a share’s metadata using
If there are several metadatas, group them by their
and create an operation for each container. Then add the operation to each container’s operation queue to run it. The operation executes its callbacks on a private serial queue.

once for each metadata you provide. CloudKit returns the metadata and its related share, or an error if it can’t accept the share. CloudKit also batches per-metadata errors. If the operation completes with errors, it returns a
error. The error stores individual errors in its
After CloudKit applies all record changes, the operation calls
. When the closure executes, the server may continue processing residual tasks of the operation, such as creating the record zone in the user’s private database.

The following example demonstrates how to accept a share that CloudKit provides to your window scene delegate. It shows how to create the operation, configure it, and execute it in the correct container:

code: // Accept the share. If successful, schedule a fetch of the
// Create a reference to the share's container so the operation
// Create the operation using the metadata the caller provides.
// If CloudKit accepts the share, cache the root record's ID.
// The completion closure handles any errors.
// If the operation fails, return the error to the caller.
// Otherwise, return the record ID of the share's root record.
// Set an appropriate QoS and add the operation to the

abstract.text: Store structured app and user data in iCloud containers that all users of your app can share.
An operation that confirms a user’s participation in a share.
The closure to execute when the operation finishes.
Creates an operation for accepting shares.
Creates an operation for accepting the specified shares.
The block to execute as CloudKit processes individual shares.
The share metadatas to process.
An error that occurs when an operation completes with partial failures.
An operation that fetches metadata for one or more shares.
The abstract base class for all operations that execute in a database.
The key to retrieve partial errors.
An object that describes a shared record’s metadata.
The ID of the share’s container.
The URL for inviting participants to the share.
The user info dictionary.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
